Topic.Title: Running Quest on Macintosh OS X

Posts.EditableText: Here is a proof we can display Quest games on Apple's Macintosh computers : [url=http://anamnese.online.fr/if/quest_macosx.jpg:47j2wuqu][img:47j2wuqu]http://anamnese.online.fr/if/quest_macosx2.jpg[/img:47j2wuqu][/url:47j2wuqu] In fact I used a windows emulator on a linux server, and displayed the result on the mac os x computer. It's not a fake, because it's possible to play this way...
Posts.HTML:
Here is a proof we can display Quest games on Apple's Macintosh computers :



In fact I used a windows emulator on a linux server, and displayed the result on the mac os x computer. It's not a fake, because it's possible to play this way...

Posts.EditableText: Not bad, but not many people are going to have one windows comp, one linux comp, and one mac os x comp in their house.  As it happens, I've got six computers in my house all running different versions of windows.  We've had every version of microsoft operating system (from DOS to Win XP Home and Pro), except Win ME.

That's cool Farvardin...

So you got WINE configured correctly or is it alot more to do with the actual MAC OS?
Posts.HTML:
That's cool Farvardin...

So you got WINE configured correctly or is it alot more to do with the actual MAC OS?

Posts.EditableText:
you don't need three computers... Only one with linux is needed, and the other one (macintosh) is displaying the linux program.

I managed to make it run on linux with an old version of wine, but with the newest I can't. Maybe I should check my configuration on the latest versions.

[edit] it's completely working now, I copied the config file from my other computer, and it was not related to the newest version of wine.
